Reviews.Title: “The only reason I gave it a TERRIBLE rating is because there isnt an option for SUPER TERRIBLE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LynnRN504
Reviews.Content: I'm normally a person that finds the silver lining in every cloud, but I literally have not one good thing to say about this hotel! SUPER HORRIBLE Customer service. Dirty, old, smelly rooms... I swear I felt like I was spending the night in the projects!!!! Extremely hard mattresses that didn't even have fitted sheets on them. When we asked for more towels, they told us their limit was two towels.... TWO FREAKING TOWELS!!!!! When the air broke in the room, we requested another room and the front desk rep LIED and said there were no more rooms available. Two seconds later I called the front desk as an anonymous caller and requested a room and the same butt hole told me there were plenty available. No matter what I write in this review, it would not begin to describe the horrible experience my friends and I had at this place. If there was an option to rate it a -10 I would!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There is something wrong with this hotel. There is a scary, unsafe, dark vibe that comes from within the rooms and hallways. I seriously felt unsafe in this hotel even though I was with my entire family. Someone tried to enter our room at 3:00 in the morning and eery creeking doors were heard in the hallway but without voices and footsteps. Thinking about it still, I get shivers down my back. If you like a good scare...stay here. If not- stay some where, any where else!!! and I believe the management is responsible for all the theft.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy and Unsafe”
Reviews.Author: gutzler
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a trip to L.A. and two nights at this hotel . We were scheduled to stay five nights but started making arrangements for other accomodations soon after check in ( we were told there were no other rooms ) . Our carpet had multiple dark brown stains and the kitchen floor was sticky . The phone didn't work , the shower curtain was mildewed and the place was generally in disrepair . The hollow wooden doors provided no security . The courtyard area has some faded charm and the breakfast was O.K. The pool area seemed a little creepy and the pool isn't heated at all. The staff seemed friendly except when we wanted to move . There are much better hotels at slightly higher prices in this area .

Reviews.Title: “Treated wonderfully at Century Wilshire”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Century Wilshire when we go to Los Angeles every year. Ken at the front desk is very accomodating and usually upgrades us to a suite when it is available. This time was no exception. Thanks to Ken we were very happy with our stay. Everyone is very friendly here and aim to please. The continental breakfast is ample and very good. You can sit inside or outside in a garden setting. The lobby is very inviting with the fragrance of fresh flowers and plants. The rates are very reasonable for the excellent location on beautiful Wilshire Boulevard within walking distance of Westwood Village. To top it off the parking is free, making this an excellent bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare On Wilshire Blvd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in everything seemed okay! I was checked in by a great front desk clerk. Upon my way up to my room I found a transient person smoking and drinking in the stair-way (the elevator was out of order). He was talking to himself and having a good time. I waved it off, but upon entering my room it was already occupied. The person in the room was just like a deer in headlights and said nothing. I walked down the stairs with my luggage and to my dismay was told that I had to stay in the room assigned to me and that the guest in their had to vacate. I was shocked because it was midnight ( I checked in late) and I inquired about housekeeping turning the room around and the front desk clerk said oh? Then he proceeded to give me an upgrade and then that room was not ready. I checked out and he had tried to charge me. I almost lost it, but I proceeded to the egress and I recommend that you do too. Walking down the stairs to the underground parking lot was very scary. There were a couple of transient people hanging out and doing I don't know what??? Be carefull and remember pay the extra money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “okay, but a little scary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am unsure that I would stay at this hotel for anything other than basic business travel--it has no electronic locks on the doors, and it felt unsafe to me. I ended up taking my PalmPilot and other valuables along with me to the conference I was attending. A woman literally walked into my room my first night there, looking for someone--I had the chain on the door, so she couldn't walk in, but it was a hazard of not having e-locks. The bathrooms had very chipped paint on the cabinets (though I did like the full, vintage-looking bathroom, which was very clean, with pretty pink tile.). Hotel staff cleaned the room up very nicely. The elevator died when I was there-I feel concerned about elderly or disabled folks in the hotel with such an unreliable elevator. I did not take advantage of the continental breakfast, but the breakfast room looked pretty. There is also a nice little business center. The staff was actually pretty nice to me and I did not have to leave my key at the desk (they said it was optional). Good location near Westwood Village.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival in my room, I found the TV not working (all snow) so I tried to call the front desk....but the phone didn't work...so I walked to the front desk and asked for help. I told the desk clerk that the phone didn't work and she said "go behind the dresser and make sure it is plugged in or wiggle the cord"...when I asked how to get the TV to work she said "how am I supposed to know?". This place is one to avoid, the main elevator feels like you are going to drop to the basement and the rooms are oh so basic (not even an alarm clock in them). You can do much better than this place...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: luvit
Reviews.Content: Spend your hard earned money elswwhere.... I used to stay at this spot back when you could get a fairly good room for $99 a night. At that time, the little 'inconveniences' were ok--since the place is in an excellent location, parking is free, and, for non-smokers, every room is a non-smoking room. Now, at a minimum of $120 a night, the Century Wilshire doesn't compare to other hotels in the area. Unless you get one of the rooms at the interior of the property, the traffic noise will keep you up all night (that is, unless you have a room abutting the apt. next door, in which case you'll also have noise from their heating/air conditioning unit). In addition, the curtains and bedspreads are filthy, people smoke in the staircases, the elevator is marginally functional, and the parking lot difficult to maneuver. For the price, you can get a clean, quiet, well managed place to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels and motels all over the world, from Motel 6's and European hostels to Four Seasons, and this was WITHOUT A DOUBT the worst hotel I've ever encountered. Room looked like it was furnished from garage sale castoffs, plumbing was atrocious, breakfast buffet was little more than toast and jam, staff was unresponsive to complaints -- and I agree with other reviewers that the place generally felt unsafe. About the only good thing that can be said is that it's within walking distance of UCLA. Otherwise it's an absolute rip-off. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a bad turn of the Century.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon our check-in at 4:50pm arriving from LAX, our room was NOT ready for occupancy. I informed the front desk and asked for another room as I should not have to wait. They seemed hesitant to give us another room, but did so anyway. The second room was half --- ready, missing a bedspread. I informed the front desk staff and they had one sent down by housekeeping. During our stay, the bottom of the shower doors hinge was completely off the track, the staff was rude and joked about the situation instead of taking it lightly as a hazard if someone were to get hurt. The continental breakfast staff was very adimant that you do not remove any dishware and take it to your room, just because you don't want to eat in a crowded room full of other guests. The parking situation sucked, as cars were stacked behind one another. And if the parking lot was full, you have to leave your car parked near the front desk and give your car keys to the front desk if they have to move the vehicle. Oh, also, at this hotel when you leave your room, you HAVE to leave your room key with the front desk staff. Let alone, giving someone the opportunity to go in your room at anytime you were not there. With all this said, the staff "supposedly" contacted the general manager about my complaint and provided an insulting $25 credit + tax. My best guess. DO NOT STAY HERE! You'll waste your money. Better off staying at they Wyndham Bel Age or somewhere. As they state on their website, "Our cozy, European Boutique style hotel fits superbly in the wide rainbow of culture, taste and people who explore, visit and reside in our vast city." I think not!

Reviews.Title: “Old World #@!$”
Reviews.Author: crispee69
Reviews.Content: While not without some charm the overall impression this hotel leaves is one of promises unfulfilled and the feeling you have stayed at a very unprofessional establishment. If you have ever stayed in a dingy little hotel in Europe you know what you are in for. Rude staff, tiny rooms, tiny showers, horrible beds and a lack of good service. Also, the fact that you have to give your room key to them before leaving is astonishingly unsafe (as mentioned in a review here.) Not only that but ANYONE can come in and say a room number and get a key. No I.D., no name check, nothing -- just "here you go." I could have asked for any room there, gone in and taken what I wanted and left. Do yourself and your belongings a favor -- go somewhere with electronic keys. The bed was the hardest rock I have ever slept on (and I've stayed in many a low price hotel.) For something in this neighborhood and price range you would expect better. I give it two stars as it does has some charm to it and the neighborhood is decent but very residential. Expect to drive everywhere -- but don't expect a parking space when you come back. The garage is tiny and dangerous. And doesn't fit all the guests cars. There was also a giant apartment party about 10 feet from our window (though not the hotel's fault -- the danger of being in that neighborhood.) We had a horrible maintenance problem as well and were told that "We're not a Howard Johnsons." ---- right -- I'd rather be there where they would fix things that were dangerously broken. There are many other hotels in the area albeit at $30-60 more a night. Do it -- this bargain is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good bargin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 nights at the Century Wilshire Hotel and found it to be a nice place, reasonabilty priced, and in a great location. Sure, it's a bit worn around the edges, but it was very clean and the staff were outstanding. Free parking is available in the hotel's basement and the continental breakfast, surrounded by guests from a varitey of countries, was a great way to start the day. On my third morning a guest sat at the hotel's piano and played some beautiful music while I read the paper and drank my morning coffee. What a great way to start your day.

Reviews.Title: “What a jewel this place is !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I read the previous reviews and quite honestly was afraid to even stay there after reading some of them. It is true the place is an old apartment building but I was very happy with it. I got a junior suite that faced the courtyard. I did not find it noisy at all. The employees were very nice---especially a lady named Devin. My suite had 3 locks on the door as opposed to the one mentioned. There is a great place to eat in the Doubletree Hotel which is next door to this hotel. If you need to go to UCLA, it is so simple to get there. You could walk if you felt ambitious but I had a ton of stuff and an infant so I opted to drive. If you have children, its very family friendly with a full kitchen minus a dishwasher. There is a full size coffee pot but I learned you need to bring the coffee. I found out later I could have had some coffee brought to my room---good thing to remember for next time. The chairs are very comfy and "broke in". Feeding my baby was wonderful as the chairs rock to. I will definitely return to the Century Wilshire if I need to stay overnight again. I did not see the parking garage but I can tell you a Hummer will not fit. They will park it for you though where it is safe. I did not check out the continental breakfast so I can not comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Noisy?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since there are many hotels to choose from I'm not sure I will rush out to the Century Wilshire. The location was ideal for my trip and I had a junior suite (don't know why... they just put me in there) which was large and had a kitchen... but the thin exterior walls and even thinner single pane glass let much traffic noise from wilshire thru... it was not bad from about 1 am til about 6 am but I never felt rested. Also the TV and/or signal/cable sucked... many times the TV just disolved to noise... Also: the elveator barely worked. Breakfast was fine-typical continental.

Reviews.Title: “Just a fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed for the first time at this hotel in 1973, and not very much has changed. But is is a hotel of a certain kind of charm, that you normally dont find i LA. Its within walking distance of the shops and restaurants in Westwood Village, which i s a great plus. There is free underground parking, another hit, and the suites are like an english country inn. The free breakfast is just coffee, but for a small charge you can have bacon and eggs or an omelette, freshly made, for 3-4 bucks. I have stayed there 3-4 times since, and I have always been safe, comfortable and satisfied. John Lindskog Travel Editor Take Off Magazine Copenhagen Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FloridaKeys
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and myself stayed at the Century Wilshire Hotel at 10776 Wilshire Blvd in Westwood from June 24 through July1, 2004. This was a great hotel- very quaint, clean and had huge rooms. No charge for parking. We rented a car at the airport and found this hotel to be close enough to drive to all the action of Hollywood Blvd.,Rodeo Drive, Getty Museum and La Museums, TV Studios, and easy to drive and get around to Chinatown, Santa Monica Pier, Malibu, Venice Beach. If you plan to rent a car and want a clean nice hotel this one is for you.My attitude is that I dont want to spend a fortune on a room but want a room I feel secure in, its clean and in a good section of town - this hotel has it all. If you are renting a car seriously consider this hotel- LA is easy to drive around in and there is no reason to spend the extra dollars some hotels require if you have a car- no matter where you go in LA you will need to drive. We felt this hotel was in a great location because it was in close proximity to everything. The employees of this hotel were very friendly and whenever we asked for directions they provided copies of maps with excellent directions! The continental Breakfast was just fine for us but for a nominal fee eggs, omelettes would be prepared for you. Our room had 2 queen beds, a full size kitchen and 2 huge closets. The bathroom had a tub and a full size walk-in shower. We had only planned to stay here part of our vacation time but because of the location and amenities we extended our stay an additional 3 days. Housekeeping did a great job also. By accident, Housekeeping removed my (white) pillowcase from the pillow I brought with me. I didnt realize it until the morning we were to check out.A few days after we returned home I received my pillowcase in the mail with a letter from the hotel management -I cant think of very many hotels that would go to this extreme- I was very impressed. Some of the mattresses were being replaced while we were there. I was told this hotel had been converted from an older apt building which explains the large rooms and atmosphere (baby grand piano in the lobby). Request a room not facing Wilshire Blvd. because like all major streets in LA there is traffic 24/7 and if you are not use to noise it may bother you. Our room faced the courtyard which we loved. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to friends and business acquaintances.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons, depends on how picky you are...”
Reviews.Author: travellingcatherine
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Century Wilshire. Here is a run down of what we found during our two day stay. We visit LA about one a year and have been staying with friends. Now that we are older, we decided to try a hotel and will definitely stay here again. We paid $100/night for two nights. Our total bill came to $235. The things we liked: - Great location just south of UCLA. All of our friends are in that area so it is perfect for our yearly visits down there. - Staff: main gentleman is helpful and nice. One of the ladies I asked a question of was a little more snotty, but she was tolerable. - Old World Charm, traditional European decor, lots of antiquey looking furniture and persian carpeting. - Room was clean. Bed was nice and firm and the sheets were very clean. Bathroom was small but very clean. Standard white hotel towels, not Egyptian cotton but clean. - Charming patio area, just as it looks in the website promotional photos - Great swimming pool - Very cute, homey feeling breakfast area which provides small continental breakfast: various toasts, english muffins, sliced melon, bananas, raisin bread, OJ, apple juice and eggs cooked to order for $3. - FREE parking - which is very hard to find in LA so this is a big plus. Most of the hotels in LA proper charge anywhere from $10-25 per night to park even as a hotel guest. The things we didn't like so much: - Wilshire is a very big, very noisy street. If you get a room facing the street, you will hear street noise and it is loud. Our room was on the corner with one wall facing the street. The windows are old fashion single pane levered glass. Very thin, you hear everything. By the second night, we were more used to it but we are both light sleepers and if street noise bothers you, you should not stay in this hotel. - The Standard Room is a little small. Quaint and cosy is the operative word here. The hotel is old so don't come here if you expect everything to be brand spanking new. The furniture is very "comfortably worn in". Bathroom was small as well. But again, we weren't expecting a suite. - There is a small lounge area with a grand piano on the first floor, but they keep the front doors wide open so it is noisy. Not suitable for a quiet chat or reading. - The doors to each room/suite are not fire rated doors so don't expect the solid doors you find in newer hotels. But we never felt unsafe. - The breakfast room is cramped but if you go eat on the patio, it is nice. It is definitely less crowded before 9:00am. Again two ways to look at it - charmingly cosy or cramped. We prefered to think of it as cosy and will stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This property is quite charming but it was not a great choice as it lacks many modern features. I found it overpriced for what you get. The staff was polite. The location is great and the parking is free. Next time I return to LA for pleasure I will chose the Magic Castle which has a similar charm but is better maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some capital improvements”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one night at this place. We were encouraged when we checked in and the desk clerk upgraded us to a junior suite. I was dismayed, however, when we reached the room. The only lock on the door was an old thumb-turn, push-button type lock. The door leading to the hall as well as the doors to the adjoining rooms on either side were hollow-core. I did not feel safe. If I didn't already know that there were almost no other hotels available in the area for the night, we'd have left. The guy next door had a lengthy cell phone conversation at 2am which woke my husband. It sounded like the guy was in our room. Combine that with the proximity of our room to Wilshire Blvd., and it was a pretty noisy night. On the plus side, the room was immaculately clean and the bed was wonderful. Even so, I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dashooz6868
Reviews.Content: I spent just one evening during my last business trip in May. Though we only reserved a standard room, the diretor of sales was kind enough to offer us a terrific upgrade (it was a suite!). The room was very well kept, and comfortable. It was too bad we only spent one night there. The complimentary breakfast could have been a little more wholesome, but it was all in all a very friendly, and comfortable atmosphere.
